meanings.definition: To remove from a list or roster.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will delist the students who did not submit their assignments.
meanings.sent2: The librarian had to delist the damaged books from the catalog.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally delisted my own name from the attendance sheet!
meanings.sent4: She felt like the forgotten character in a story, delisted from the main plot.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to delist objects from existence with a flick.

meanings.definition: To take off a stock exchange.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to delist its shares from the stock market.
meanings.sent2: Investors were surprised when the company announced its plan to delist.
meanings.sent3: The stock market felt a bit lighter after the company chose to delist.
meanings.sent4: The decision to delist sent shockwaves through the financial world.
meanings.sent5: The delisting of the company's shares was a bold move that made headlines.
